solution_line_template: If the rabbit food costs ${rabbit_food_weekly_cost} a week, then the parrot food costs ${total_weekly_cost} - ${rabbit_food_weekly_cost} = ${parrot_food_weekly_cost} a week.

Julia has the parrot for {parrot_weeks} weeks, so she spent {parrot_weeks} weeks * ${parrot_food_weekly_cost}/week = $<<{parrot_weeks}*{parrot_food_weekly_cost}={spent_on_parrot}>>{spent_on_parrot} on her.

The rabbit is her only for {rabbit_weeks} weeks, so she spent {rabbit_weeks} weeks * ${rabbit_food_weekly_cost}/week = $<<{rabbit_weeks}*{rabbit_food_weekly_cost}={spent_on_rabbit}>>{spent_on_rabbit} on him.
In total, Julia spent ${spent_on_parrot} + ${spent_on_rabbit} = $<<{spent_on_parrot}+{spent_on_rabbit}={total_spent}>>{total_spent} on food for her animals.
